instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message: I have an A1706 (2017) MacBook Pro (touch bar) with the following issue: with the battery disconnected, it starts up and works fine. With the battery connected, it produces kernel panics, usually before it finishes start up. No liquid damage that I can see. I tried NVRAM, SMC reset, and starting from an external SSD.

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message:
You should get a known good working battery for test.

Start in diagnostic mode, maybe get some information.

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message: Diagnostics (with connected battery) shows no issues. Will try with new battery and report back.

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message: The issue is unchanged with a new battery.

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message: It was advertised as "authentic Apple", but I have my doubts. Do you have a suggestion for buying a good OEM battery for this model?

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message: You should get a known good working battery for test first.

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message: The machine now started kernel-panicking even with the battery unplugged. Report attached. Worth going to a good BIOS or suspect bad CPU?[ATTACH type="full"]59828[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-00923 MacBook Pro kernel panics with battery connected
threads.message: You should try known good BIOS clean ME, nothing to lose.
